page.title: 11Retirement in Willingham
page.content: There is one retirement home in the village called{Willingham House.}All the residents come from within a fifteen mile radius and they are aged 70 and upwards. They have their own rooms and share communal lounge and dining facilities and are looked after by a{matron and staff.}The home is set in attractive grounds where the residents enjoy sitting out in good weather. The{Friends of Willingham {House}help to organise recreational activities and arrange visits to such events as concerts at the local school. Most of the residents have relatives living locally but there is often no room or facilities for them to be looked after at home. Some elderly people live in rented accommodation provided by the{Josiah {Smith Homes}charity.
